ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: DSM criteria of most major adult mental illnesses; cognitive models of psychopathology.
This class provided an extensive and detailed overview of psychopathology and current issues within clinical psychology.
I learned a lot about psychopathology. We read papers about multiple aspects of a bunch of different diseases and I also learned a lot about how to write a research proposal.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: Jutta is extremely knowledgeable about this tops given years of experience as a researcher and clinician. The small class size fostered a really good learning environment and good discussion. The guest lectures (Drs. Klonsky, Baskin-Sommers and Cannon) were very engaging and a nice way to bring in Yale's experts on their respective subjects. Weaknesses: It often felt that too much time was spent on complex cognitive models as opposed to other etiological models of psychopathology (more neuroscience, biological, and environmental emphasis would have complemented the cognitive material better). In addition, the student-led discussions that were meant to be built into class did not always go quite as planned (mostly from not leaving enough time or getting sidetracked from the discussion leader's prepared questions).

Strong course. It could have been nice if some of the readings considered some other perspectives (i.e. a lot of the papers covered psychopathology from a cognitive perspective, and I would've been interested to read some more about underlying biological processes)
As a combined lecture-discussion the parts of the class designed to survey the material went very smoothly and covered a lot of material in a way that made sense and I understood.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, think this is a great course for any students looking to gain more insight into the realm of psychopathology
I would. As an undergrad without a ton of psych experience I think I learned a lot and doing all the reading I was able to keep up with it, it was a very meaningful class to me.
